alert.note: Alert for Seward (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 4:16AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Seward County through 445 AM CDT... At 416 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 3 miles northeast of Goehner, or 5 miles southwest of Seward, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Seward around 420 AM CDT. Milford around 435 AM CDT. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 375 and 388. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
